features: EXCEPTIONAL DESIGN: enjoy mirror finish, classic look and professional performance. Aluminum encapsulated base heats quickly and spreads heat evenly– eliminating hot spots
PREMIUM COOKING: stainless steel cooking surface does not discolor, react with food or alter flavors. Measurement markings for ease of use, drip free pouring, and flavor lock lid

CLEAN UP: dishwasher safe for an easy clean up

body.description: The kitchens of France were the inspiration behind the elegant Cuisinart Chef's Classic Stainless Cookware Collection, and our 8" Skillet does not disappoint. Featuring induction ready stainless steel and a pure aluminum encapsulated base for fast and even heating, frying and sautéing is simple. We even included measurement markings for ease of use. Features: Induction-ready|Mirror finish. Classic looks professional performance.|Aluminum encapsulated base heats quickly and spreads heat evenly. Eliminates hot spots.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great pan for one
reviews.reviewText: This is a beautiful and well made pan. It is easier to clean if you use some sort of a spray on it rather than using butter or margarine. I found this pan difficult to clean but I was using butter or margarine to coat the inner bottom & sides. I use this little pan to cook eggs. My daughter used it one day using a common spray for pans. I was happy that the pan was much easier to clean that day. It is a wonderful little pan, perfect for scrambled eggs for one or two people. I’ve also put it in the dishwasher with no ill effects. I highly recommend this beautifully made pan.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Cooks evenly and easy to clean; is a decent weight and not flimsy at all.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is my go to egg pan every morning. While it is not non-stick, with a little spray oil, eggs don't stick to it. What little bit does stick around the edges comes right off when you soak it for just a few minutes. It is a good weight and cooks evenly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Can't flip eggs
reviews.reviewText: It's a decent pan. Good non stick surface, but, you can't flip an egg without a spatula. The lip just doesn't allow it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little pan OK
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a small frying pan for just a couple of eggs instead of having to use a big frying pan and have to clean it. I ordered this pan and it is just what I wanted, I always think this is a very high-quality company, and it evidently has an aluminum core between there covering of the pan that is nice even heating. I’m noticing you don’t ever have to go on high, it has such good heat it distribution that low to medium does the job. There’s a good finish on it and things just slide right out. I am very pleased.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great pan, great price!
reviews.reviewText: Great pan for the price! Learn how to use stainless steel before giving it poor ratings please!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect little pan
reviews.reviewText: I used to use teflon-coated pans but after living in a furnished place for a time, and using stainless, I bought new pans. This one is perfect, the right size for small meals, nice good weight, the heat is dispersed well, cooks well, and cleans up well. Trick I learned is to sit some water in the pan after it cools down a bit, and let it sit for an hour or so, and easy breezy removing everything that stuck to the pans. Use a bit of butter or cooking or olive oil and it cleans up very nicely. And to get it cleaned extra well, every so often I use Barkeepers Friend cleaner and it takes it back very nicely. I have a larger Cuisinart pan too, love them both. I cook everythin in them, rice in the small pan, and it cooks faster, spinach is perfect in the larger pan, do grilled chicken, vegetables, steak, making a cheeseburger with onions right now as I write this. It's perfect.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: If pre-heated well, this is truly a non stick pan. I use it every morning for eggs.
Después de un año de uso puedo decir que es exelente, calidad en el material desde el sartén hasta el mango, fácil de limpiar.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 5, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: Perfect small frying pan - Ideal for eggs.
reviews.reviewText: A wonderful little frying pan. All stainless steel with an aluminium sandwich in the base makes for good heat transfer. If you cook on gas, as I do, keep the flames small and within the "double" base area.I guess you can tell from my spelling of "aluminium" that I am in the UK and could not find a similar product over here which is why I was so pleased to see this on Amazon.com (US) Delivery was very quick about 5 days.People have said than plain stainless steel isn't non-stick! It is if you condition the pan by heating a small quantity of oil until smoking just starts, allow to cool slowly and then discard the oil. Finally get the oil to the right temperature before breaking eggs into the pan and they will not stick. Much safer and longer lasting than coated pans where the coating peels off or becomes toxic if overheated.
A good wonderful frying pan from cuisinart.

reviews.reviewTitle: Un sartén para profesionales al alcance de los novatos
reviews.reviewText: Quizá de todas las opciones que analicé este sartén no fue la opción más barata, pero ya estaba cansado de gastar cada dos o tres años en sartenes recubiertos de teflón que terminaban perdiendo la capa de antiadherente por no saber como cuidarlos. Dedique un par de días a investigar que ventajas tiene usar un sartén de acero inoxidable y en el proceso descubrí que ningún fabricante te dice como cuidar el sartén que te costó mucho dinero ni mucho menos te aclaran en que tipo de cocción es más eficiente el suyo, el gran gancho es (en el caso de los de teflón) la promesa de que la comida no se te va a pegar. Así que sugiero a quien haya llegado a esta parte de mi reseña leer el blog de "el comidista" dedicado a la comparación de sartenes (" ALUMINIO, HIERRO O ACERO INOXIDABLE: ¿QUÉ SARTÉN COMPRO?" y también ver los videos de youtuber "recetas flipantes" dedicados a como curar un sartén de acero inoxidable.Dicho lo anterior, y dejando a un lado la utopía de tener un sartén al que no se le pegue nada, puedo decirles que como simple aficionado a la cocina tomé una buena decisión al comprar este sartén para profesionales porque está hecho de materiales de buena calidad, tiene alma de aluminio y teniendole los cuidados adecuados me va a durar muchos años. Lo mejor es que aceptando que el buen cocinar requiere planificación, dedicación y paciencia he logrado preparar una muy ricas omelettes sin quemarlas ni dejarlas pegadas en el sartén. Por cierto, si la comida se llega a pegar, lo lavas con agua tibia y jabón y queda como nuevo.

BAD PRODUCT. I've used this only 3 times and this has already happened to the frying pan. Overall, I don't think this is good quality. It's HORRIBLE. The way it splatters when butter or oil goes on. It's burnt my eye.
